steps.content: Make sure your deviceâ€™s software is up to date to get the ğŸ« emoji. The ğŸ« emoji was included in 2022â€™s Emoji 15.0 release, approved as part of Unicode 15.0. So, if you donâ€™t see it on your emoji keyboard, your device (phone, tablet, or computer) might not have up-to-date software. There, you can download available updates and turn on automatic updates if you want to. Android : In the Settings app, select System > Software Update to see and download available updates . If you're struggling to find it in your emoji library, the ğŸ« emoji's Unicode is U+1FACE, and it can be typed with :moose:.
